resources.string: Mahadev is the god of destruction, and the third of the Trimurti.
Rama is the seventh and one of the most popular avatars of Vishnu.
Radha Krishna is the combined form of the Hindu god Krishna with his chief consort and shakti Radha.
Durga Mata is a major Hindu goddess, worshipped as a principal aspect of the mother goddess Mahadevi. She is associated with protection, strength, motherhood, destruction, and wars.
Brahma is the god of creation, and the first of the Trimurti. His consort, as well as his shakti, is Saraswati, the goddess of learning.
Vishnu is the god of preservation, and the second of the Trimurti. He is generally regarded to be the entity who is most often involved in mortal affairs.
Parvati is also the goddess of love and devotion, or Kamakshi, the goddess of fertility, abundance and food/nourishment, or Annapurna.
Saraswati is the goddess of learning, and also the patroness of music, art, and speech. The goddess is also regarded to be the power that resides within all poetry and writing.
Lakshmi is the goddess of prosperity, associated with material and non-material wealth, fortune, and beauty. She is the consort of the preserver deity, Vishnu.

Ganesha, also spelled Ganesh, also called Ganapati, elephant-headed Hindu god of beginnings, who is traditionally worshipped before any major enterprise and is the patron of intellectuals, bankers, scribes, and authors.
See more or less information about a god.
